   1315.01  CONSTRUCTION, ETC.; PERMIT REQUIRED; REQUIREMENTS FOR BUILDINGS
SUBJECT TO OBBC.
   (a)   Before proceeding with the construction, alteration, repair, removal
or demolition of any building or other structure, a permit shall be obtained
from the Building Official.
   (b)   No Village permit shall be issued with respect to a building or
structure subject to the Ohio Building Code until a State approved set of final
plans and specifications and a copy of the State permit issued with respect
thereto have been submitted to the Building Official and reviewed by the
Architectural Board of Review in conjunction with its review of those aspects
of the location and construction of such building or structure which are
subject to this Building and Housing Code. All inspections of construction
pursuant to the State approved plans and specifications shall be conducted by
State authorized and approved inspectors. Architectural Board of Review
approvals and the Village permit shall indicate that they are limited to those
matters subject to these Codified Ordinances. The fee for such limited permit
shall be one-half of the usual fee provided in Section
1315.10.
(Ord. 2014-03. Passed 4-8-14.)
   1315.02 APPROVAL OF SEWAGE FACILITY BY HEALTH BOARD OR OEPA.
   The Building Official is hereby ordered to require all applicants for
permits to construct or alter a dwelling within the Village, to secure the
approval of the Cuyahoga County Board of Health or the State Environmental
Protection Agency, as may be required, of all plans and specifications for the
sewage treatment plant to be constructed for use in connection with the
occupancy of such dwelling. Until such approval is secured by such applicant,
the Building Official shall refuse to issue a permit to construct or alter a
dwelling within the Village. However, should such application be for a permit
to alter a dwelling upon a parcel of land where a sewage treatment plant has
already been constructed, and such plant has adequately disposed of the sewage
from such dwelling, such approval shall not be required.
(Ord. 2014-03. Passed 4-8-14.)
   1315.03  CONSTRUCTION GUARANTEE DEPOSIT; COMPLETION OF WORK AND INSPECTION.
   (a)   Before the owner or his or her agent shall construct an improvement on
any property within the Village, and at the time of securing a permit for the
construction, enlargement, alteration, repair or removal of any building or
other structure, the owner or his or her agent shall deposit with the Clerk an
amount equal to one dollar ($1.00) per square foot of the building or other
structure proposed to be constructed, but not less than one hundred dollars
($100.00), as the Building Official shall determine to be sufficient to
guarantee:
      (1)   That any damage to the streets, sidewalks, curbing, tree lawns or
berms within the Village shall be repaired and restored to their original
condition at the cost and expense of the owner;
      (2)   That the work for which the permit was issued shall be completed in
accordance with the approved plans and specifications; and
      (3)   That the information required by the permit application and CCA
Form 120-71, or equivalent, has been fully and correctly provided.
   (b)   Upon the failure of the owner or his or her agent to replace or
restore such streets, sidewalks, curbing, tree lawns or berms to their original
condition upon the completion of the work for which the permit was issued and
the deposit made to the satisfaction of the Building Official, the Building
Official shall have such work performed and shall pay the cost and expense
thereof out of the fund so deposited, and in the event the deposited sum shall
not be sufficient to pay such cost and expense, the owner shall be liable to
the Village for any balance.
   (c)   Upon completion of the work for which the permit was issued and the
deposit made, the owner or his or her agent shall request the Building Official
to make an inspection for the purpose of determining what refund, if any,
should be made from the deposit. Twenty-five dollars ($25.00) of the deposit
shall be retained by the Village to cover the cost of each such inspection.
After charges for such work by the Village and the cost of inspection have been
deducted from the deposit, the balance shall be refunded to the owner if the
requirements of paragraph (a)(3) hereof have been met.
   (d)   If the work contemplated by the aforesaid permit has not been
completed at the expiration of two years from the date of making such deposit,
or if the necessary repairs or restoration to the streets, sidewalks, curbing,
tree lawns or berms have not been made as required hereunder, such deposit or
any portion thereof then remaining shall be forfeited to the Village.
(Ord. 2014-03. Passed 4-8-14.)
   1315.04 TOPOGRAPHIC SURVEY.
   Each application for preliminary approval of building plans shall be
accompanied by a topographic survey, as set forth below, and shall contain all
information shown on such form. If the Building Official, after consultation
with the Architectural Board of Review, shall determine that further study is
desirable with respect to soil conditions, subsurface water conditions, surface
drainage, flood plain elevations, construction or other conditions where
engineering advice should be obtained, the applicant shall pay to the Village
that sum required to cover the fees and expenses of the Village Engineer and
any related fees for outside services pertaining thereto. No building permit
shall be issued until such topographic survey has first been approved by the
Village Engineer. No construction, erection, addition to or moving of any
building shall proceed after the footers are in place, until the Building
Official has approved the grade. The Building Official may waive the
requirement of a topographic survey where the remodeling, alteration or
addition will be constructed in conformity with the established grade.
(Ord. 2014-03. Passed 4-8-14.)
   1315.05  PERMIT ISSUANCE; EFFECTIVE PERIOD; COMPLETION OF WORK AND
INSPECTION; VEGETATIVE COVERING.
   (a)   When specifications and drawings submitted pursuant to this chapter
shall be found to conform to the requirements of this Building and Housing
Code, the Building Official shall issue a permit and affix to the
specifications and drawings his or her official stamp, stating that examination
has been made and the permit issued. One copy of such stamped specifications
and plans shall be returned to the applicants and shall be continuously kept at
the site of the proposed work throughout its construction period. The second
copy shall be filed with the permanent records of the Building Official. The
stamping of any specification or drawing shall not be held to permit or be an
approval of any violation of any section of this Building and Housing Code, nor
shall the issuance of any permit for a part of a structure be held to imply or
require the approval of any remaining part of such structure for which complete
specifications and drawings were not submitted at the time of issuance of the
permit for a part of the structure.
   (b)   Any permit so issued shall become invalid as required by 105.3 of the
Residential Code of Ohio.
   (c)   Upon issuing a building permit, the Building Official shall fix the
reasonable time necessary to complete the work authorized by the permit, taking
into consideration the time for completion as estimated by the applicant, the
nature of the work and the effect of seasonal and weather conditions, and shall
note the completion date on the building permit.
   (d)   Upon completion of the building work authorized by the permit in
accordance with the plans, specifications and drawings, the owner, builder or
his or her representative shall request a final inspection by the Building
Official. No building shall be used or occupied until its completion in
accordance with the plans, specifications and drawings has been approved by the
Building Official. Upon application and for good cause shown, the Building
Official may extend the completion date for delays caused by conditions beyond
the control of the owner or builder, or for other good and sufficient reasons.
   (e)   Within six months from the date originally fixed by the Building
Official for the completion of the work authorized by the permit, the property
upon which the building is located shall be finish graded and seeded or sodded
with quality grass, seed or sod or planted with other ground covering in
accordance with the site improvement plan submitted with the application for a
building permit and shall be continuously maintained thereafter.
   (f)   Failure to complete the work authorized by the permit or failure to
grade and seed or sod the property as required by the provisions of this
section shall constitute a violation of this section. (Ord. 2014-03. Passed 4-
8-14.)
   1315.06 DENIAL OF PERMITS FOR NONCOMPLIANCE.
   If the information contained in any application for a permit, or in
specifications or drawings accompanying such application, indicates that the
work to be done is not clearly and specifically defined, is imperfect or is not
in all respects in accordance with the provisions of this Building and Housing
Code or other applicable law, ordinance or regulation, the Building Official
shall not issue a permit until the deficiencies or violations shall have been
in all respects corrected.
(Ord. 2014-03. Passed 4-8-14.)
   1315.07 ALTERATION OF APPLICATIONS.
   No person shall alter, erase or modify in any way any line, figure, word or
coloring contained in or upon any application, specification or drawing which
has been stamped by the Building Official. (Ord. 2014-03. Passed 4-8-14.)
   1315.08 DEVIATIONS FROM APPLICATION, SPECIFICATIONS OR DRAWINGS.
   No person shall do or cause to be done anything which shall cause any change
or deviation from the terms of an application, specifications or drawings, in
any manner affecting the structural features or the stability of the structure,
unless the permission of the Building Official shall, prior to the commencement
of such change or deviation, have been asked for and granted, both in writing.
(Ord. 2014-03. Passed 4-8-14.)
   1315.09 WHEN PERMIT NOT REQUIRED.
   No permit shall be required for minor interior or exterior repairs, nor for
alterations to or within structures, which alterations do not involve any
change in structural parts, stairways, chimneys, heating apparatus, means of
ingress or egress, light or ventilation.
(Ord. 638. Passed 11-14-46.)
   1315.10  PERMIT FEE; FEES FOR PLAN REVIEW AND INSPECTIONS.
   (a)   The fee to be paid when making application for a permit shall be an
amount equal to two dollars per square foot of the footprint of the building or
other structure to be constructed, but not less than one hundred dollars
($100.00).
   (b)   The Building Official, in addition to all other fees and deposits
required by these sections of Codified Ordinances, shall be authorized to
charge and deposit with the Clerk the following fees for plan review and
inspections:
 
      (1)   Building Department plan review fee$100.00
      (2)   Site/topographic plan review fee   100.00
      (3)   1% fee for Ohio Board of Building Standards
      (4)   Building setback and footer inspect175.00
      (5)   Rough grade inspection             100.00
      (6)   Finished grade inspection          100.00
      (7)   Final building and landscape inspec125.00
   (Ord. 2014-03. Passed 4-8-14.)
   1315.11  TEMPORARY FENCING DURING CONSTRUCTION.
   As a condition of the issuance of a permit, the Building Official shall
require the permittee to temporarily fence areas to be disturbed by
construction before any clearing may commence. The purpose of the fencing shall
be to delineate the area to be disturbed and to protect non-disturbed
vegetation on the site.
(Ord. 2014-03. Passed 4-8-14.)
   1315.12 HOURS OF CONSTRUCTION.
   As a condition of issuance of a permit, the Building Official shall require
the permittee, together with all persons working on the construction site, to
comply with the following hours of construction: No outside construction shall
commence on weekdays and Saturdays before 7:30 a.m. or continue past 8:00 p.m.,
or on national holidays or Sundays before 9:00 a.m. or past 5:00 p.m. (Ord.
2014-03. Passed 4-8-14.)
   1315.13 PROHIBITING PERMITS WITHIN SPECIFIED DISTANCES OF OIL AND GAS WELLS
AND TANK BATTERIES.
   No permit may be issued for an uninhabited structure or accessory structure
within one hundred (100) feet of an oil and gas well or a tank battery. No
permit may be issued for a habitable structure or accessory structure within
three hundred thirty (330) feet of an oil and gas well or a tank battery. Prior
to issuing any permit for a structure or accessory structure, the Building
Official shall check with the Ohio Department of Natural Resources, Division of
Mineral Resources, to determine whether a permit has been issued for an oil and
gas well or tank battery or has been applied for on the property on which the
structure is to be located.
(Ord. 2014-03. Passed 4-8-14.)
   1315.99  PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
1311.99 for general Building and Housing Code penalty if no specific penalty is
provided.)
                                                                                                
CHAPTER 1317
Certification of Inspection
1317.01   Owner defined.
1317.02   Certification of inspection and of septic system
   evaluation required.
1317.03   Applications and issuance.
1317.04   Presentation of certificates to tenants, transferees, etc.;
   deposit of statement of receipt.
1317.05   Disbursal of funds without statement prohibited.
1317.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
   Inspections of buildings - see Ohio R.C. 715.26(B),
      737.34 et seq.
   Power of municipalities to provide for inspections - see
      Ohio R.C. 715.46
   Right of entry of Building Official - see B. & H.
1311.03
   Inspection of unsafe structures - see B. & H.
1367.08
   Right of entry re unsafe buildings - see B. & H.
1367.17
   Inspection of water supply - see B. & H.
1371.03
   Fire inspections - see F.P.
1511.04,
1511.09
   1317.01  OWNER DEFINED.
   As used in this chapter, "owner" means the owner or owners of a premises and
the buildings, structures or other installations located thereon, including the
holder of title thereto subject to contract of purchase, a vendee in
possession, a mortgagee or receiver in possession, a tenant or lessee of the
whole thereof or any agent or other person, firm, corporation or fiduciary in
possession or control thereof. The person, firm or corporation who or which
signs the application for a certificate of inspection or, if required, a Septic
System Certificate, shall be deemed prima facie to be the owner.
(Ord. 2251. Passed 12-5-87.)
   1317.02  CERTIFICATION OF INSPECTION AND OF SEPTIC SYSTEM EVALUATION
REQUIRED.
   No owner of any premises with a dwelling, building, structure or other
installation located thereon within the Village shall enter into an agreement
to rent, lease, sell, convey or transfer such premises without first obtaining
from the Building Official a certificate of inspection of such premises, and
without presenting a copy of such certificate of inspection to the prospective
tenant, lessee, purchaser, grantee or transferee, and, if such premises are
served by a septic system, without obtaining from the County Board of Health a
certification of septic system evaluation (the "Septic System Certificate").
(Ord. 2014-03. Passed 4-8-14.)
   1317.03 APPLICATIONS AND ISSUANCE.
   (a)   Applications for a certificate of inspection shall be made upon forms
supplied by the Building Official.
      (1)   The Building Official shall cause a general inspection of the
premises to be made, in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1367. Such inspection shall be made solely for and on behalf of the Village and
there shall be no liability or responsibility to any present or future owner or
occupant of such premises resulting therefrom.
      (2)   The certificate of inspection shall contain the following
information:
         A.   The location and other identifying characteristics of the
buildings, structures and other installations;
         B.   The name and address of the owner;
         C.   The authorized use and occupancy of the buildings, structures and
other installations; and
         D.   A list of all violations ascertained at the time of such
inspection, under and pursuant to Chapter
1367.
      (3)   The certificate of inspection shall be valid for a period of ninety
days from the date of such inspection.
   (b)   An application for a Septic System Certificate shall be made upon
forms supplied by the County Board of Health and shall be issued by such Board,
contain such information and be valid for such period as determined in the
regulations of the Board pertaining to Septic System Certificates. (Ord. 2014-
03. Passed 4-8-14.)
   1317.04  PRESENTATION OF CERTIFICATES TO TENANTS, TRANSFEREES; ETC.; DEPOSIT
OF STATEMENT OF RECEIPT.
   No person, agent, firm or corporation shall rent, lease, sell, convey or
transfer any premises with a dwelling, building, structure or other
installation located thereon within the Village, or any interest therein,
without presenting to the prospective tenant, lessee, purchaser, grantee or
transferee a current certificate of inspection, and, if required, a Septic
System Certificate, and, when an escrow has been established, depositing in
escrow prior to delivery of possession or transfer of title, a statement
acknowledging the receipt thereof. (Ord. 2251. Passed 12-5-87.)
   1317.05 DISBURSAL OF FUNDS WITHOUT STATEMENT PROHIBITED.
   No person, firm or corporation acting in the capacity of an escrow agent in
any real estate transaction involving the sale of any premises with a dwelling,
building, structure or other installation located thereon within the Village
shall disburse any funds until the provisions of Section
1317.04 have been complied with.
(Ord. 2251. Passed 12-5-87.)
   1317.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
1311.99 for general Building and Housing Code penalty if no specific penalty is
provided.)
                                                                                                
CHAPTER 1319
Registration of Prime Contractors
1319.01   Registration of prime contractors required.
1319.02   Permit issuance only to registered prime contractors.
1319.03   Exception for owners.
1319.04   Qualifications of applicants.
1319.05   Appeals.
1319.06   Waiver of requirements.
1319.07   Applications for registration; fee.
1319.08   Expiration and renewal of certificates; renewal fee.
1319.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
   Power to license house movers, electricians, plumbers,
      sewer tappers and vault cleaners - see Ohio R.C.
      715.27
   Construction Industry Examining Board - see Ohio
      R.C. 4740.01    et seq.
   Unlawful interest in contracts - see GEN. OFF.
506.17
   Tree cutting contractors - see P. & Z.
1173.11
   1319.01  REGISTRATION OF PRIME CONTRACTORS REQUIRED.
   (a)   No person, firm or corporation shall, on and after July 1, 1972,
engage in the business or act in the capacity of a prime contractor, as defined
herein, except pursuant to a certificate of registration issued in conformity
with the provisions of this chapter by the Building Official, unless such
person, firm or corporation is otherwise exempted from registration by the
provisions of this chapter.
   (b)   "Prime contractor," for the purpose of this chapter, means any
individual, firm, copartnership, corporation, association or other
organization, or any combination of any thereof, who or which, by himself,
herself or itself, or by or through others, constructs, alters, repairs, adds
to, subtracts from, reconstructs or remodels any building, structure or
appurtenance thereto, or who or which undertakes or offers to undertake, or
purports to have the capacity to undertake, or submits a bid to do so, any such
activity.
(Ord. 2014-03. Passed 4-8-14.)
   1319.02  PERMIT ISSUANCE ONLY TO REGISTERED PRIME CONTRACTORS.
   No permit required by the provisions of this Building and Housing Code shall
be issued for work to be undertaken by contract except to a registered prime
contractor.
(Ord. 1606. Passed 6- 12-72.)
   1319.03  EXCEPTION FOR OWNERS.
   (a)   No provision of this chapter shall be interpreted to require that the
owner or any regular employee of the owner of a dwelling, building or other
structure located within the Village must hold a registration certificate to
perform work upon such dwelling, building or other structure.
   (b)   All such work shall be done in conformity with the provisions of the
Residential Code of Ohio and this Building and Housing Code and rules and
regulations promulgated thereunder, and no work shall be done unless all
permits, inspections and approvals required by the Residential Code of Ohio and
this Building and Housing Code are obtained.
   (c)   Any person who misrepresents any material fact in securing an
exception under the provisions of this section shall be deemed to be in
violation of this chapter and subject to the penalties provided therefor.
(Ord. 2014-03. Passed 4-8-14.)
   1319.04 QUALIFICATIONS OF APPLICANTS.
   (a)   No applicant shall be issued a certificate of registration under the
provisions of this chapter unless such applicant shall be:
      (1)   Legally able to enter into a binding contract;
      (2)   Able to read and write the English language; and
      (3)   Of good moral character. In considering moral character, an
applicant with a record of violations of this Building and Housing Code or of
other laws or ordinances regulating building construction in the Village, or of
dishonest practices, or of lax, incompetent, negligent or derelict practices in
the conduct of his or her business, trade or profession, may be deemed to be of
poor moral character and it shall therefore be deemed to be in the public
interest that such applicant shall be issued a certificate of registration.
   (b)   When an applicant for registration is a firm or corporation, each
responsible member of such firm or corporation, who shall be listed as such in
the application, shall individually be qualified for registration under the
provisions of this chapter.
   (c)   A certificate of registration may be revoked or may be suspended by
the Building Official for a prescribed period not exceeding twelve months,
whenever he or she has determined that the holder thereof:
      (1)   Has not performed the duties required of him or her by this
Building and Housing Code or by the rules and regulations of the Building
Official or the Architectural Board of Review; or
      (2)   Has been lax, incompetent, negligent or derelict in the performance
of his or her work or in the furnishing of services authorized by any such
certificate; or
      (3)   Has departed from or disregarded plans or specifications filed with
an application for a building permit; or
      (4)   Has violated or participated in the violation of any of the
provisions of this Building and Housing Code or other applicable provisions of
these Codified Ordinances.
   (d)   Notice in writing shall be given to a registrant by the Building
Official of any noncompliance with, or violation of, any of the provisions of
this Building and Housing Code or of any other building, plumbing, electrical,
sanitary or other provision of these Codified Ordinances. The registrant shall
remedy or cause to be corrected any such noncompliance or violation within five
days after the receipt of such notice. Failure to comply with the terms of such
notice or the orders of the Building Official shall result in the suspension or
revocation of the registrant's certificate, or prosecution, or both.
   The holder of a suspended certificate shall not do any work authorized by
such certificate, except work necessary to correct a violation specified in the
notice of suspension, until notice of reinstatement has been given by the
Building Official or the period of suspension has expired.
(Ord. 2014-03. Passed 4-8-14.)
   1319.05  APPEALS.
   A registrant whose certificate of registration has been suspended or revoked
may appeal such order of suspension or revocation, in writing, to the
Architectural Board of Review. The Board shall afford a hearing upon such
appeal, at which the appellant may be represented by counsel. The appellant and
the Building Official may present and examine witnesses and introduce testimony
pertaining to the reasons for suspension or revocation and to restoration of
the certificate of registration. All such appeals shall be filed with the Board
within five days after receipt of the notice or order from which an appeal is
taken. The decision of the Board shall be final and conclusive as to all
parties, subject to the provisions of Ohio R.C. Chapter 2506.
(Ord. 2014-03. Passed 4-8-14.)
   1319.06 WAIVER OF REQUIREMENTS.
   If, in the opinion of the Building Official, the value of the work to be
performed, within the meaning and intent of this chapter will be less than five
hundred dollars ($500.00), he or she may waive the registration requirements of
this chapter.
(Ord. 2014-03. Passed 4-8-14.)
   1319.07 APPLICATIONS FOR REGISTRATION; FEE.
   Applications for registration shall be made to the Building Official on
forms to be furnished by him or her, accompanied by an initial registration fee
of one hundred twenty-five dollars ($125.00). (Ord. 2014-03. Passed 4-8-14.)
   1319.08  EXPIRATION AND RENEWAL OF CERTIFICATES; RENEWAL FEE.
   All certificates of registration and all renewals thereof shall expire on
December 31 of each year, but may be renewed, provided that all incidents of
noncompliance with or violations of applicable building or construction codes
by the registrant have been corrected, upon application for renewal of the
certificate to the Building Official and upon payment of a renewal fee of one
hundred ten dollars ($110.00) for each certificate sought to be renewed.
(Ord. 2014-03. Passed 4-8-14.)
   1319.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
1311.99 for general Building and Housing Code penalty if no specific penalty is
provided.)
CHAPTER 1321
Certificate of Authorized Occupancy
1321.01   Definitions.
1321.02   Certificate of authorized occupancy.
1321.03   Application, inspection and issuance.
1321.04   Fees.
1321.05   Revocation.
1321.06   New or remodeled rental dwelling unit.
1321.07   Changes in agent.
1321.08   Changes in ownership; new certificate required.
1321.09   Change in use or occupancy; new certificate required.
1321.10   Sale of rental dwelling unit.
1321.99   Penalty; equitable remedies.
   1321.01 DEFINITIONS.
   For purposes of this Chapter, “Rental Dwelling Unit” shall mean: a building
or structure used, in whole or in part, for residential purposes, where either
money or other valuable consideration is paid or serves as consideration for a
person or persons to occupy all or part of such building or structure for
residential purposes.
(Ord. 2014-28. Passed 4-14-15.)
   1321.02 CERTIFICATE OF AUTHORIZED OCCUPANCY.
   On or after the effective date of this Chapter, no person shall occupy a
Rental Dwelling Unit, and no owner, agent, or person in charge of any Rental
Dwelling Unit, shall rent or lease Rental Dwelling Unit unless the owner
thereof holds a certificate of authorized occupancy (“Certificate”) issued by
the Village Building Official (“Building Official”) for the Rental Dwelling
Unit, which Certificate has not expired, been revoked or otherwise become null
and void.
(Ord. 2014-28. Passed 4-14-15.)
   1321.03 APPLICATION, INSPECTION AND ISSUANCE.
   (a)   Application. An initial application for a Certificate shall be made
separately for each Rental Dwelling Unit to the Building Official on forms
supplied by the Official and shall be accompanied by the fee required by the
provisions of this Chapter. The application shall be made in writing by
supplying necessary information to determine compliance with applicable laws,
ordinances, rules and regulations for the existing use or occupancy or the
intended use or occupancy. Such information shall include, but need not be
limited to, the following:
      (1)   The name, address, and telephone number of the owner of the
property;
      (2)   The name, address, and telephone number of the agent or person in
charge of the property; if any;
      (3)   The address of the property and the number of Rental Dwelling Units
contained in the building or structure; and
      (4)   The current name, address, and telephone number of all persons who
are occupying, or who are anticipated to occupy, the Rental Dwelling Unit, and
the address or identification of the building or structure which they are
occupying. The Building Official may require the submission of an affidavit
stating the foregoing information. If any of the required information changes
during the period for which a Certificate is issued, such changes shall be
conveyed within thirty (30) days of such change to the Building Official to
allow for updating of records.
   (b)   Inspection. The Building Official shall inspect or cause to be
inspected the interior premises and exterior premises and property areas of the
building or structure used for Rental Dwelling Unit purposes within thirty (30)
days of the initial application for a Certificate and upon any change of
occupancy or ownership described in this Chapter. Where no change of occupancy
or ownership has occurred, the Building Official shall inspect or cause to be
inspected the interior premises and exterior premises and property areas of the
Rental Dwelling Unit at least every three (3) years.
   (c)   Issuance. If it is found that a Rental Dwelling Unit is in compliance
with the provisions of this Chapter and all other laws, ordinance, rules and
regulations applicable thereto, the Building Official shall issue a
Certificate. A Certificate for such Unit shall contain the following
information:
      (1)   The street address or other identifying characteristics of the
building or structure used for Rental Dwelling Unit purposes.
      (2)   The name and address of the owner of the Residential Dwelling Unit,
and, if the owner does not reside on the premises, the name and address of the
resident agent in charge of the Rental Dwelling Unit, and the name and address
of the nonresident agent, if any.
      (3)   The exact nature and extent of the use or occupancy authorized.
      (4)   The time period for which such Certificate of authorized occupancy
is issued.
   (d)   Certificate must be valid. Such Certificate shall be valid for the
time period set forth thereon, until a change or alteration of the premises
alters the authorized occupancy, or unless the owner or person in charge fails
to timely report a change in the information required by subsection (a) hereof.
(Ord. 2014-28. Passed 4-14-15.)
   1321.04 FEES.
   (a)   An initial application for a Certificate shall be accompanied by a
nonrefundable fee of two hundred dollars ($200.00) for each Rental Dwelling
Unit. The initial application fee shall be waived if the Rental Dwelling Unit
is already registered as required by this Chapter, or is registered as required
by this Chapter within 30 days after its effective date. All Certificates shall
be renewed on a yearly basis by January 1, of each calendar year.
   (b)   The yearly fee for renewing a Certificate shall be one hundred dollars
($100.00) for each Rental Dwelling Unit.
   (c)   In addition to the penalty and remedies set forth in Section
1321.99 of this Chapter, in the event an owner, agent, or person in charge of
any Rental Dwelling Unit fails to timely submit a complete and proper
application pursuant to Sections
1321.02 and
1321.03 of this Chapter, an additional fee of one hundred twenty-five dollars
($125.00) shall be charged to such owner, agent, or person in charge prior to
the issuance of a Certificate.
   (d)   If the person responsible for paying the fees set forth in this
section fails to make the payment of any such fees within sixty (60) days after
the date a notice of delinquency of fee payment has been sent to such person by
regular United States Mail:
      (1)   The Building Official shall report the failure to make payment and
the amount owed in writing to Village Council; and
      (2)   Upon Council’s receipt of the report of the amount owed in
subsection (d)(1) of this section, it shall make written return to the Fiscal
Officer of Cuyahoga County of the Village’s action to collect the delinquent
fees with the statement of the amount owed on those delinquent fees and a
description of the premises of the person responsible for paying the fee for
which the Certificate was required, for the purpose of making the same a lien
upon the lands of said premises, to be collected as other taxes and returned to
the Village.
      (3)   An administrative fee of $150.00 shall be added to the total amount
owed pursuant to Section
1321.04(a) through (c) by the owner of each Rental Dwelling Unit for which the
failure to make the necessary payments was reported to the Village Council by
the Building Official. Said administrative fee shall be added to the amount
reported to the County Fiscal Officer to be collected as taxes.
         (Ord. 2014-28. Passed 4-14-15.)
   1321.05 REVOCATION.
   The Building Official shall have the power to revoke a Certificate if any
false statement is made by the applicant in connection with the issuance of
such Certificate, or for noncompliance of a Rental Dwelling Unit or its use
with the requirements of this Chapter, or if the owner, agent or person in
charge of a Unit refuses to comply with any provisions of this Chapter.
(Ord. 2014-28. Passed 4-14-15.)
   1321.06 NEW OR REMODELED RENTAL DWELLING UNIT.
   (a)   The owner of a Rental Dwelling Unit which will be completed or
remodeled and available for occupancy which requires a Certificate shall apply
for such Certificate as soon as practicable, but in no event shall the Unit be
occupied in whole or in part until the Certificate has been issued. Failure to
so apply will be deemed to be a violation of this Chapter and will subject the
owner of the Unit to the legal action and penalty described herein.
   (b)   Any new or remodeled Rental Dwelling Unit must also comply with
Chapter
1317 of this Code.
(Ord. 2014-28. Passed 4-14-15.)
   1321.07 CHANGES IN AGENT.
   In the event there is a change in the resident agent or nonresident agent as
shown by the Certificate, the owner shall notify the Building Official in
writing within thirty (30) days of such change, giving the name, address and
telephone number of the new resident agent or nonresident agent. Failure to so
notify the Building Official within the specified time shall constitute a
violation of this Chapter. (Ord. 2014-28. Passed 4-14-15.)
   1321.08 CHANGES IN OWNERSHIP; NEW CERTIFICATE REQUIRED.
   In the event there is a change in ownership of record, the Certificate
issued under the provisions of this Chapter to the former owner shall become
null and void within thirty (30) days of the recorded date of such change of
ownership and a new Certificate must be obtained by the new owner, provided the
new owner will continue to have a Rental Dwelling Unit. Application for such
new Certificate shall be made not more than thirty (30) days after such change
in ownership has occurred, on forms supplied by the Building Official. A fee of
one hundred dollars ($100.00) shall be paid upon application for each such new
Certificate. The new Certificate shall expire on the same date as that of the
Certificate which it replaces.
(Ord. 2014-28. Passed 4-14-15.)
   1321.09 CHANGE IN USE OR OCCUPANCY; NEW CERTIFICATE REQUIRED.
   Any change in the nature or extent of the use or occupancy as specified on
the Certificate shall render the Certificate null and void upon the happening
of such change. No such change is permissible under this Chapter unless such
change has been approved by the proper Village authorities pursuant to this
Chapter, and unless a new Certificate, incorporating such change, has been
issued. Any such change without the approval of the proper Village authorities
will subject the owner, operator or agent to the penalties provided in this
Chapter.
(Ord. 2014-28. Passed 4-14-15.)
   1321.10 SALE OF RENTAL DWELLING UNIT.
   Before an owner enters into an agreement for the sale of a Rental Dwelling
Unit, that owner shall exhibit to the prospective buyer of such premises a copy
of the Certificate for the premises being sold. As evidence of the owner’s
compliance with the requirements of this Chapter, the owner shall obtain the
signature of the prospective buyer, or the buyer’s agent, on the Certificate
for such premises or on a copy thereof, in the space indicated on the
Certificate, together with the date of such signing.
(Ord. 2014-28. Passed 4-14-15.)
   1321.99 PENALTY; EQUITABLE REMEDIES.
   (a)   Whoever violates or fails to comply with any of the provisions of this
Chapter is guilty of a misdemeanor of the first degree and shall be fined or
imprisoned or both for each offense in accordance with Section
598.02 of the General Offenses Code. Unless otherwise provided, a separate
offense is deemed to have been committed each day during or on which a
violation or noncompliance occurs or continues.
   (b)   The application of the penalty provided in subsection (a) shall not be
deemed to prevent the enforced removal of prohibited conditions and/or the
application of any other equitable remedy.
(Ord. 2014-28. Passed 4-14-15.)

Flood Damage Reduction

1341.04   Use and development standards for Flood Hazard Reduction.
1341.05   Appeals and variances.
1341.06   Enforcement.
CROSS REFERENCES
   Flood control by soil conservation district supervisors - see

   Flood insurance - see Ohio R.C. 3925.34(C), 3941.02(A)(1)
